description.text: A hot runner system is a molten plastic conveying unit used within an injection mold. It consists of heated components (generally via electricity) used inside the plastic injection molds, which brings the molten plastic from the barrel of an injection molding machine into the cavities of the mold

Ein Heißkanalsystem ist eine Fördereinheit für geschmolzenen Kunststoff, die in einer Spritzgussform verwendet wird. Es besteht aus beheizten Komponenten (in der Regel über Strom), die in den Kunststoff-Spritzgießwerkzeugen verwendet werden und den geschmolzenen Kunststoff aus dem Zylinder einer Spritzgießmaschine in die Kavitäten des Werkzeugs bringen
Submodel containing techical data of the asset and associated product classificatons.
Teilmodell, das die technischen Daten der Anlage und die zugehörigen Produktklassifizierungen enthält.
Individual characteristics that describe the product and its technical properties.
Contains the dimensions and weight of the asset
Beinhaltet die Gewichte und Abmaße des Assets
For objects with orientation in preferred position during use the dimension perpendicular to diameter/height/width/depth
Bei eher rechtwinkeligen Körpern die größte orthogonal zu Durchmesser/Höhe/Breite/Tiefe stehende Ausdehnung parallel zu einer Symmetrieachse
For objects with orientation in preferred position during use the dimension perpendicular to height/ length/depth
Bei eher rechtwinkeligen Körpern die orthogonal zu Höhe/Länge/Tiefe stehende Ausdehnung rechtwinklig zur längsten Symmetrieachse
For objects with fixed orientation or in preferred utilization position, the rear , generally away from the observer expansion is described as depth
Bei Gegenständen mit fester Orientierung oder in bevorzugter Gebrauchslage wird die nach hinten, im Allgemeinen vom Betrachter weg verlaufende Ausdehnung als Tiefe bezeichnet
Net weight of a component or an element
Nettogewicht einer Komponenten oder eines Elements
Connection of the mold with the hot runner device
Anschluss des Werkzeugs mit dem Heißkanalgerät
Type of the connector plug
Typ des Steckereinsatzes
The characteristics for the heater and the feeler are defined in separate properties
Die Eigenschaften für die Heizung und den Fühler sind in separaten Merkmalen definiert

description.text: Quantitative statement about the set of contact points
Quantitative Angabe zur Menge der Anschlusspunkte an einer Klemme

Gibt an, welcher geometrische Grundkörper die äußere Gestalt des Gerätes bestimmt bzw. ob es sich um eine genormte Bauform handelt

Angabe, ob ein Betriebsmittel mit Arretierung ausgestattet ist oder nicht

Angabe, ob ein Betriebsmittel mit Arretierung ausgestattet ist oder nicht

Die Eigenschaften für die Heizung und den Fühler sind zusammen in einem Merkmal definiert

Quantitative Angabe zur Menge der Anschlusspunkte an einer Klemme

Größtmögliche von der Heizung abgegebene Wärmeleistung

Vorhandene Spannung im Stromnetz
Highest allowable temperature at which a device may operate
Höchste zulässige Temperatur, bei der ein Gerät betrieben werden darf
Lowest allowable temperature at which a device is allowed to operate
Niedrigste zulässige Temperatur, bei der ein Gerät betrieben werden darf
Upper limit of the temperature range of the surrounding space in which the component, the pipework or the system can be operated
Oberer Grenzwert des Temperaturbereichs des umgebenden Raumes in dem das Bauteil, das Leitungssystem oder die Anlage betrieben werden darf
Lower limit of the temperature range of the surrounding space in which the component, the pipework or the system can be operated
Unterer Grenzwert des Temperaturbereichs des umgebenden Raumes in dem das Bauteil, das Leitungssystem oder die Anlage betrieben werden darf
Indicates if a sensor for thermal balancing is present
Zeigt an, ob ein Sensor für den thermischen Ausgleich vorhanden ist
This variable is used to specify the type of connected external temperature sensor
Diese Variable gibt das verwendete Thermoelement an
In hot runner nozzles, a distinction is made between three different design principles, i.e., internally heated, open hot runner, and needle shut-off
Bei Heißkanaldüsen unterscheidet man zwischen drei verschiedenen Konstruktionsprinzipien, nämlich innenbeheizt, offener Heißkanal und Nadelverschluss
The maximal stroke the needle is allowed to dive into the mold
Der maximale Hub, den die Nadel in das Werkzeug eintauchen darf
Indicates the accuracy with which a controller operates
Gibt die Genauigkeit an, mit der ein Regler arbeitet
Quantitative statement about the set of heating zones
Quantitative Angabe zur Menge an Heizzonen
Type of plug that connects the device
Typ des Steckers, an den das Gerät angeschlossen wird

Contains the nameplate information attached to the product
Note: see also [IRDI] 0112/2///61987#ABN590#001 URI of product instance
Note: see also [IRDI] 0112/2///61987#ABA565#007 manufacturer Note: mandatory property according to EU Machine Directive 2006/42/EC.
Note: see also [IRDI] 0112/2///61987#ABA567#007 name of product Note: Short designation of the product is meant. Note: mandatory property according to EU Machine Directive 2006/42/EC.

The SMC “ContactInformation” contains information on how to contact the manufacturer or an authorised service provider, e.g. when a maintenance service is required. Note: physical address is a mandatory property according to EU Machine Directive 2006/42/EC

enumeration: 0173-1#07-AAS927#001 (administrativ contact), 0173-1#07-AAS928#001 (commercial contact), 0173-1#07-AAS929#001 (other contact), 0173-1#07-AAS930#001 (hazardous goods contact), 0173-1#07-AAS931#001 (technical contact). Note: the above mentioned ECLASS enumeration should be declared as “open” for further addition. ECLASS enumeration IRDI is preferable. If no IRDI available, custom input as String may also be accepted.

Note: see also [IRDI] 0112/2///61360_4#ADA005#001 country code. country codes defined accord. to DIN EN ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 codes. Mandatory property according to EU Machine Directive 2006/42/EC. Recommendation: property declaration as MLP is required by its semantic definition. As the property value is language independent, users are recommended to provide maximal 1 string in any language of the user’s choice.
Note: language codes defined accord. to ISO 639-1. Note: as per ECLASS definition, Expression and representation of thoughts, information, feelings, ideas through characters.
Note: notation accord. to ISO 8601 Note: for time in UTC the zone designator “Z” is to be used
Note: see also [IRDI] 0112/2///61987#ABA129#001 city/town. Mandatory property according to EU Machine Directive 2006/42/EC.

Recommendation: property declaration as MLP is required by its semantic definition. As the property value is language independent, users are recommended to provide maximal 1 string in any language of the user’s choice.

enumeration: 0173-1#07-AAS754#001 (office), 0173-1#07-AAS755#001 (office mobile), 0173-1#07-AAS756#001 (secretary), 0173-1#07-AAS757#001 (substitute), 0173-1#07-AAS758#001 (home), 0173-1#07-AAS759#001 (private mobile)

Recommendation: property declaration as MLP is required by its semantic definition. As the property value is language independent, users are recommended to provide maximal 1 string in any language of the user’s choice.

Note: conditionally mandatory property according to EU Machine Directive 2006/42/EC. One of the two properties must be provided: ManufacturerProductFamily (0173-1#02-AAU731#001) or ManufacturerProductType (0173-1#02-AAO057#002).

Note: see also [IRDI] 0112/2///61987#ABA300#006 code of product Note: conditionally mandatory property according to EU Machine Directive 2006/42/EC. One of the two properties must be provided: ManufacturerProductFamily (0173-1#02-AAU731#001) or ManufacturerProductType (0173-1#02-AAO057#002).

Note: see also [IRDI] 0112/2///61987#ABA950#006 order code of product Note: Recommendation: property declaration as MLP is required by its semantic definition. As the property value is language independent, users are recommended to provide maximal 1 string in any language of the user’s choice.

Note: see also [IRDI] 0112/2///61987#ABA581#006 article number Note: Recommendation: property declaration as MLP is required by its semantic definition. As the property value is language independent, users are recommended to provide maximal 1 string in any language of the user’s choice.
Note: see also [IRDI] 0112/2///61987#ABA951#007 serial number
Note: mandatory property according to EU Machine Directive 2006/42/EC.
Note: see also [IRDI] 0112/2///61987#ABB757#007 date of manufacture Note: format by lexical representation: CCYY-MM-DD

Note: see also [IRDI] 0112/2///61987#ABA926#006 hardware version Note: Recommendation: property declaration as MLP is required by its semantic definition. As the property value is language independent, users are recommended to provide maximal 1 string in any language of the user’s choice.

Note: see also [IRDI] 0112/2///61987#ABA302#004 firmware version Note: Recommendation: property declaration as MLP is required by its semantic definition. As the property value is language independent, users are recommended to provide maximal 1 string in any language of the user’s choice.

Note: see also [IRDI] 0112/2///61987#ABA601#006 software version Note: Recommendation: property declaration as MLP is required by its semantic definition. As the property value is language independent, users are recommended to provide maximal 1 string in any language of the user’s choice.
Note: see also [IRDI] 0112/2///61360_4#ADA034#001 country of origin Note: Country codes defined accord. to DIN EN ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 codes
Note: CE marking is declared as mandatory according to EU Machine Directive 2006/42/EC.
Note: see also [IRDI] 0112/2///61987#ABH515#003 Certificate or approval Note: CE marking is declared as mandatory according to the Blue Guide of the EU-Commission

Note: see also [IRDI] 0173-1#02-BAB392#015 certificate/approval valueId with ECLASS enumeration IRDI is preferable, e.g. [IRDI] 0173-1#07-DAA603#004 for CE. If no IRDI available, string value can also be accepted. Note: CE marking is declared as mandatory according to Blue Guide of the EU-Commission
Note: Approval identifier, reference to the certificate number, to be entered without spaces
Note: format by lexical representation: CCYY-MM-DD Note: to be specified to the day
Note: see also ([IRDI] 0173-1#02-AAO997#001 Validity date Note: format by lexical representation: CCYY-MM-DD Note: to be specified to the day
Note: see also [IRDI] 0173-1#02-AAM954#002 details of other certificate
Note: Approval identifier, reference to the certificate number, to be entered without spaces

Note: see also [IRDI] 0112/2///61987#ABA231#008 type of hazardous area approval Note: name of the approval system, e.g. ATEX, IECEX, NEC, EAC, CCC, CEC Note: only values from the enumeration should be used as stated. For additional systems further values can be used. Note: Recommendation: property declaration as MLP is required by its semantic definition. As the property value is language independent, users are recommended to provide maximal 1 string in any language of the user’s choice.

Note: see also [IRDI] 0112/2///61987#ABA634#004 approval agency/testing agency Note: name of the agency, which has issued the certificate, e.g. PTB, KEMA, CSA, SIRA Note: only values from the enumeration should be used as stated. For additional systems further values can be used. Note: Recommendation: property declaration as MLP is required by its semantic definition. As the property value is language independent, users are recommended to provide maximal 1 string in any language of the user’s choice.

Note: see also [IRDI] 0112/2///61987#ABA589#002 type of protection (Ex) Note:  ·       Type of protection for the device as listed in the certificate ·       Symbol(s) for the Type of protection. Several types of protection are separated by a semicolon “;” ·       If several TypeOfProtection are listed in the same certificate, for each TypeOfProtection a separate SMC “Explosion Safety” shall be provided
Note: Um(eff) Note: Insulation voltage, if specified in the certificate
Note: Reference to the instruction manual or control drawing
Note: X if any, otherwise no entry
Note: If the device is mounted in the process boundary, ambient and process conditions are provided separately.

Note: see also [IRDI] 0112/2///61987#ABA467#002 equipment/device category Note: editorial definiton: Category of device in accordance with directive 2014/34/EU Note: Equipment category according to the ATEX system. According to the current nameplate, also the combination “GD” is permitted Note: The combination “GD” is no longer accepted and was changed in the standards. Currently the marking for “G” and “D” must be provided in a separate marking string. Older devices may still exist with the marking “GD”.

Note: see also [IRDI] 0112/2///61987#ABA464#005 equipment protection level Note: editorial definition: Level of protection assigned to equipment based on its likelihood of becoming a source of ignition Note: Equipment protection level according to the IEC standards. According to the current nameplate, also the combination “GD” is permitted Note: The combination “GD” is no longer accepted and was changed in the standards. Currently the marking for “G” and “D” must be provided in a separate marking string. Older devices may still exist with the marking “GD”. Note: Recommendation: property declaration as MLP is required by its semantic definition. As the property value is language independent, users are recommended to provide maximal 1 string in any language of the user’s choice.
Note: see also [IRDI] 0112/2///61987#ABA589#002 type of protection (Ex) Note: Symbol(s) for the Type of protection. Several types of protection are separated by a semicolon “;”

Note: see also [IRDI] 0112/2///61987#ABA961#007 permitted gas group/explosion group Note: Equipment grouping according to IEC 60079-0 is meant by this property Note: Symbol(s) for the gas group (IIA…IIC) or dust group (IIIA…IIIC)

Note: see also [IRDI] 0112/2///61987#ABA621#007 minimum ambient temperature Note: editorial defnition: lower limit of the temperature range of the environment in which the component, the pipework or the system can be operated Note: Rated minimum ambient temperature Note: Positive temperatures are listed without “+” sign. If several temperatures ranges are marked, only the most general range shall be indicated in the template, which is consistent with the specified temperature class or maximum surface temperature. Other temperature ranges and temperature classes/maximum surface temperatures may be listed in the instructions.

Note: see also [IRDI] 0112/2///61987#ABA623#007 maximum ambient temperature Note: editorial definition: upper limit of the temperature range of the environment in which the component, the pipework or the system can be operated Note: Rated maximum ambient temperature Note: Positive temperatures are listed without “+” sign. If several temperatures ranges are marked, only the most general range shall be indicated in the template, which is consistent with the specified temperature class or maximum surface temperature. Other temperature ranges and temperature classes/maximum surface temperatures may be listed in the instructions.

Note: see also [IRDI] 0112/2///61987#ABB159#004 maximum surface temperature for dust-proof Note: Maximum surface temperature of the device (dust layer ≤ 5 mm) for specified maximum ambient and maximum process temperature, relevant for Group III only Note: Positive temperatures are listed without “+” sign. If several temperatures ranges are marked, only the most general range shall be indicated in the template, which is consistent with the specified temperature class or maximum surface temperature. Other temperature ranges and temperature classes/maximum surface temperatures may be listed in the instructions.

Note: see also [IRDI] 0112/2///61987#ABA593#002 temperature class Note: editorial definition: classification system of electrical apparatus, based on its maximum surface temperature, intended for use in an explosive atmospheres with flammable gas, vapour or mist. Note: Temperature class for specified maximum ambient and maximum process temperature, relevant for Group II only (Further combinations may be provided in the instruction manual).
Note: If the device is mounted in the process boundary, ambient and process conditions are provided separately.

Note: see also [IRDI] 0112/2///61987#ABA467#002 equipment/device category Note: editorial defnition: Category of device in accordance with directive 2014/34/EU Note: Equipment category according to the ATEX system.

Note: see also [IRDI] 0112/2///61987#ABA464#005 equipment protection level Note: editorial defnition: Level of protection assigned to equipment based on its likelihood of becoming a source of ignition Note: Equipment protection level according to the IEC or other standards, e.g. Ga (IEC), Class I/Division 1 (US), Zone (EAC) Note: Recommendation: property declaration as MLP is required by its semantic definition. As the property value is language independent, users are recommended to provide maximal 1 string in any language of the user’s choice.
Note: see also [IRDI] 0112/2///61987#ABA589#002 type of protection (Ex) Note: Symbol(s) for the Type of protection. Several types of protection are separated by a semicolon “;”

Note: see also [IRDI] 0112/2///61987#ABA961#007 permitted gas group/explosion group Note: editorial definition: classification of dangerous gaseous substances based on their ability to be ignited Note: Equipment grouping according to IEC 60079-0 is meant by this property Note: Symbol(s) for the gas group (IIA…IIC) or dust group (IIIA…IIIC)

Note: Rated minimum process temperature Note: Positive temperatures are listed without “+” sign. If several temperatures ranges are marked, only the most general range shall be indicated in the template, which is consistent with the specified temperature class or maximum surface temperature. Other temperature ranges and temperature classes/maximum surface temperatures may be listed in the instructions.

Note: Rated maximum process temperature Note: Positive temperatures are listed without “+” sign. If several temperatures ranges are marked, only the most general range shall be indicated in the template, which is consistent with the specified temperature class or maximum surface temperature. Other temperature ranges and temperature classes/maximum surface temperatures may be listed in the instructions.

Note: see also [IRDI] 0112/2///61987#ABB159#004 maximum surface temperature for dust-proof Note: Maximum surface temperature (dust layer ≤ 5 mm) for specified maximum ambient and maximum process temperature, relevant for Group III only Note: Positive temperatures are listed without “+” sign. If several temperatures ranges are marked, only the most general range shall be indicated in the template, which is consistent with the specified temperature class or maximum surface temperature. Other temperature ranges and temperature classes/maximum surface temperatures may be listed in the instructions.

Note: see also [IRDI] 0112/2///61987#ABA593#002 temperature class Note: editorial definition: classification system of electrical apparatus, based on its maximum surface temperature, intended for use in an explosive atmospheres with flammable gas, vapour or mist. Note: Temperature class for specified maximum ambient and maximum process temperature, relevant for Group II only (Further combinations may be provided in the instruction manual).

Note: If several external circuits can be connected to the device, this block shall provide a cardinality with the number of circuits Note: If for one external IS circuit several sets of safety parameters are provided (e.g. for several material groups), each set is specified in a separate block as a separate circuit.

Note: For each circuit the designation of the terminals shall be specified. If several circuits are provided with the same parameters, their terminal pairs are listed and separated by a semicolon. If several circuits belong to one channel this shall be described in the instructions.

Note: see also [IRDI] 0112/2///61987#ABA589#002 type of protection (Ex)) Note:  ·       Type of protection for the device as listed in the certificate ·       Symbol(s) for the Type of protection. Several types of protection are separated by a semicolon “;” ·       If several TypeOfProtection are listed in the same certificate, for each TypeOfProtection a separate SMC “Explosion Safety” shall be provided

Note: see also [IRDI] 0112/2///61987#ABA464#005 equipment protection level Note: editorial definition: Level of protection assigned to equipment based on its likelihood of becoming a source of ignition Note: EPL according to IEC standards Note: value should be chosen from an enumeration list with values “Ga, Gb, Gc, Da, Db, Dc, Ma, Mb”  Note: Recommendation: property declaration as MLP is required by its semantic definition. As the property value is language independent, users are recommended to provide maximal 1 string in any language of the user’s choice.

Note: see also [IRDI] 0112/2///61987#ABA961#007 permitted gas group/explosion group Note: editorial definition: classification of dangerous gaseous substances based on their ability to be ignited Note: Equipment grouping according to IEC 60079-0 is meant by this property Note: Symbol(s) for the gas group (IIA…IIC) or dust group (IIIA…IIIC)

Note: see also [IRDI] 0112/2///61987#ABC585#001 Safety related properties for active behaviour Note: IS-parameters for active circuits, if relevant (e.g. power supply, IS-barriers)
Note: see also [IRDI] 0112/2///61987#ABA987#001 maximum output power (Po) Note: Limit value for output power
Note: see also [IRDI] 0112/2///61987#ABA989#001 maximum output voltage (Uo) Note: Limit value for open circuits output voltage
Note: see also [IRDI] 0112/2///61987#ABA988#001maximum output current (Io) Note: Limit value for closed circuit output current

Note: see also [IRDI] 0112/2///61987#ABA991#001 maximum external inductance (Lo) Note: Maximum external inductance to be connected to the circuit

Bei Gegenständen mit fester Orientierung oder in bevorzugter Gebrauchslage wird die nach hinten, im Allgemeinen vom Betrachter weg verlaufende Ausdehnung als Tiefe bezeichnet

description.text: Internally heated hot runner nozzles are rarely used today because the temperature of the heating car-tridge cannot be adequately controlled

definition.text: Internally heated hot runner nozzles are rarely used today because the temperature of the heating car-tridge cannot be adequately controlled

description.text: Open and internally heated hot runner nozzles be-long to the group of gating systems that are mechan-ically torn off when opening the mold
Offene und innenbeheizte Heißkanaldüsen gehören zur Gruppe der Angusssysteme, die beim Öffnen des Werkzeugs mechanisch abgerissen werden

definition.text: Open and internally heated hot runner nozzles be-long to the group of gating systems that are mechan-ically torn off when opening the mold

description.text: Needle shut-off nozzles are not among the nozzles that tear off when opening the mold. The separation only takes place when the needle in the nozzle closes. On the molded part, only an imprint, similar to an ejector pin, can be seen. For this rea-son, needle shut-off nozzles are often used for high quality plastic parts

Nadelverschlussdüsen gehören nicht zu den Düsen, die beim Öffnen der Form abreißen. Die Abtrennung erfolgt erst, wenn sich die Nadel in der Düse schließt. Auf dem Formteil ist nur ein Abdruck, ähnlich wie bei einem Auswerferstift, zu sehen. Aus diesem Grund werden Nadelverschlussdüsen häufig für hochwertige Kunststoffteile verwendet

definition.text: Needle shut-off nozzles are not among the nozzles that tear off when opening the mold. The separation only takes place when the needle in the nozzle closes. Nadelverschlussdüsen gehören nicht zu den Düsen, die beim Öffnen der Form abreißen. Die Abtrennung erfolgt erst, wenn sich die Nadel in der Düse schließt. Auf dem Formteil ist nur ein Abdruck, ähnlich wie bei einem Auswerferstift, zu sehen. Aus diesem Grund werden Nadelverschlussdüsen häufig für hochwertige Kunststoffteile verwendet
